vcard_page.heading: What is a vCard?
vcard_page.intro: A vCard is a standardized file format (.vcf) for sharing contact information. It contains details like name, phone number, email address, company, and more – all in a small text file.
vcard_page.usage_heading: What is a vCard used for?
vcard_page.usage_text: vCards are used to share contact information easily and without errors. Instead of typing in a phone number, you can transfer the data directly to your address book via QR code or file.
vcard_page.scan_iphone: iPhone: Open the Camera app and point it at the QR code. A notification will appear to save the contact.
vcard_page.scan_android: Android: Most camera apps detect QR codes automatically. Alternatively, you can use Google Lens.
vcard_page.print_heading: Printing QR codes on business cards
vcard_page.print_text: Download the QR code as PNG (1024×1024 pixels) or SVG (vector graphic). For printing, we recommend a minimum size of 2×2 cm and SVG format for the best quality.
vcard_page.format_text: This tool uses vCard 3.0 – the most widely supported and compatible format. It works with all common smartphones and contact apps.

faq.heading: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.a1: A vCard can contain name, phone numbers, email addresses, company, job title, address, website, and social profiles. All fields are optional – you can include exactly what you want to share.
faq.q2: How big should I print the QR code?
faq.a2: For reliable scanning, we recommend a minimum size of 2×2 cm. For business cards, 2.5×2.5 cm usually works well. The more data in the QR code, the larger it should be printed.
faq.q3: Which file format should I use?
faq.a3: For printing, we recommend SVG (vector graphic) – it can be printed at any size without loss of quality. PNG works well for digital use (email signatures, websites).
faq.q4: Does the QR code work on all phones?
faq.a4: Yes. vCard QR codes work on iPhones and Android devices. The camera app recognizes the QR code and offers to save the contact.
faq.a5: No. Everything happens directly in your browser. No data is sent to a server, stored, or shared.
faq.q6: Can I customize the QR code colors?
faq.a6: Yes. You can customize the QR code color and background. Just make sure there is enough contrast so the code remains easy to scan.
